required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Switch to Bictegravir/Emtricitabine/Tenofovir Alafenamide After Renal Transplant
clinical_study.official_title: The Efficacy, Safety, and Tolerability of Switching to a Bictegravir (BIC)/Emtricitabine(FTC)/Tenofovir Alafenamide (TAF) Regimen in Virally Suppressed HIV-Positive Patients Post-Renal Transplant

lead_sponsor.agency: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

clinical_study.source: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label study, where participants will be switched from their current HIV medication to the study drug, Biktarvy. Open-label means both the investigator and the participant will know what drug will be given. Participants will be followed for 48 weeks in order to monitor the efficacy, safety and tolerability of Biktarvy. The investigator hypothesizes that Biktarvy will be an important addition to the management of HIV-positive post renal transplant patients, especially since it is a one pill daily dosing regimen, thereby decreasing the pill burden in this population.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with plasma HIV-1 RNA <50 copies/ml
primary_outcome.description: HIV viral loads will be obtained from lab reports

primary_outcome.measure: Safety, as measured by number of participants with at least one adverse event
primary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately 1 month after final study visit
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events will only include those that are determined to be related to the study drug

primary_outcome.measure: Change in tolerated dose of Biktarvy in HIV positive post renal transplant participants as measured by HIV Treatment Satisfaction Questionnaire
primary_outcome.time_frame: Week 4, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, Week 48, 3 Month Follow Up, 6 Month Follow Up
primary_outcome.description: Tolerability will be measured by the health-related quality of life questionnaire to assess satisfaction with a one pill regimen. The health-related questionnaire ranges from 0 to 6 with higher scores indicating greater satisfaction.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in interaction between plasma concentrations for Bictegravir/Emtricitabine/Tenofovir alafenamide, intracellular TAF levels, tacrolimus levels, and renal function
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 3, Day 5, Day 8, Day 11, Day 22, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 16, Week 20, Week 24, Week 28, Week 32, Week 36, Week 40, Week 44, Week 48 (End of study), 3 Month Follow Up, 6 Month Follow Up
primary_outcome.description: Relationships will be determined by linear regression analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in CD4+ T lymphocyte cell count/percentages post renal transplant
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Week 4, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, Week 48 (End of study), 3 Month Follow Up, 6 Month Follow Up
secondary_outcome.description: CD4 lymphocyte counts and percentages will be obtained from lab reports

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between rejection rates of the kidney transplant post renal and Tacrolimus levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately 3 months after primary outcome completion
secondary_outcome.description: Data for kidney graft rejection rates will be extracted from biopsy confirmed rejections and observed along with levels of Tacrolimus obtained from blood samples.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in participants satisfaction with reduced pill burden, as measured by the health-related quality of life questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 4, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, Week 48 (End of study), 3 Month Follow Up, 6 Month Follow Up
secondary_outcome.description: Satisfaction will be measured by the self-reporting health-related quality of life questionnaire ranging from 0 to 6 with higher scores indicating greater satisfaction with Biktarvy.

arm_group.description: Participants receive a Biktarvy tablet orally once daily with or without food.

intervention.description: A three-drug fixed dose combination tablet containing 50mg of bictegravir, 200mg of emtricitabine, and 25mg of tenofovir alafenamide.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- At least 18 years old on day of signing informed consent
- Positive for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)
- Received a previous renal transplant
- Must have controlled HIV infection for at least 3 months prior to enrollment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Received a kidney from a donor who was HIV positive (unless a false positive)
- Currently taking Biktarvy for treatment of HIV
- Has allergies to any of the HIV medications in Biktarvy (bictegravir, emtricitabine, or tenofovir alafenamide)
- Currently taking dofetilide or rifampin
- Is pregnant or breastfeeding
